attributes.action: fund the public investment in transport without imposing a congestion charge in Cambridge.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We note that:
 
The government insists on imposing the congestion charge as a condition for receiving the money to improve transport in the city.  Local authorities bidding for extra funds have no choice but to include congestion charging in their plans, regardless of need.  
 
The charge is estimated to be £4 for Cambridge, working out at over £1,000 per year per car, with no reductions for residents or for those leaving the city to work outside it.
 
The study on transport was only just completed before the decision was announced.
 
No study was undertaken on the impact on employment in the city before the decision was announced.
 
No study on the economic impact was carried out before the decision was announced.
 
No assurances can be given about the extension of residents’ parking zones, their prices or the costs of public parking.
 
There will be no referendum on the introduction of the charges, as there was in Edinburgh.

The long term funding for transport was capped and the money that would have gone to it as part of natural growth forms the ‘TIF’ cash which local authorities have to bid for.  This system needs reviewing.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
